content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-16-A |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=A |Title=Defining delayed puberty in boys and girls |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=16}} Delayed puberty is defined as the absence of breast development after the age of 13 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 14 in a boy.

properties.question: At what ages is delayed puberty typically defined for boys and girls?
properties.option_a: After the age of 12 in girls and after the age of 13 in boys
properties.option_b: After the age of 13 in girls and after the age of 14 in boys
properties.option_c: After the age of 14 in girls and after the age of 15 in boys
properties.option_d: After the age of 15 in girls and after the age of 16 in boys
